q1.question: What does Devon's band do in kind to the number one band?
q1.recall: At the BET Big Southern Classic, A&T's drumline mimics the move that caused a fight at their homecoming game, but then drops their sticks and continues playing. They end their routine by dropping their sticks onto Morris Brown's drums.
q1.vectordb: Devon's band focuses on various styles of music rather than what music is currently popular on the radio and requires all members to read music. Devon is demoted to P4 by Dr. Lee until he learns to read music, then later put back on P1 when Wagner pressures Dr. Lee to do so.

q2.question: What is the character of Devon?
q2.answer: ['lead character and best drummer', 'the main character']
q2.recall: Devon is a talented drummer who initially struggles with reading music and has a cocky attitude. He is eventually kicked out of the A&T band for showboating and inciting a fight with a visiting band. He briefly considers playing for a rival band but ultimately returns to A&T and works to improve his attitude and relationship with his fellow band members. He is eventually allowed to play in a face-off against Morris Brown and is shown to have improved his character.
q2.vectordb: Devon is initially portrayed as a talented but cocky and disrespectful freshman, but he learns humility and the importance of teamwork through his experiences in the A&T marching band. He is also shown to be dedicated to his craft and willing to work hard to improve.

q8.question: What prevents Devon from"starting"?
q8.recall: Devon's inability to read music initially prevents him from starting in the marching band at A&T University. Later on, his showboating and lack of respect for the band's teamwork and traditions lead to his expulsion from the band. However, he eventually patches up his relationships and is given a chance to play in the face-off against Morris Brown's band. So, it is his own attitude and behavior that prevent him from starting initially and cause his expulsion from the band.
q8.vectordb: Devon's attitude and lack of respect prevent him from playing in the band, and ultimately lead to his expulsion.
